text:
Solomonov, Vernick, Starr: Familiar foodie names on list of 2017 James Beard nominations Updated: March 15, 2017 — 2:58 PM EDT 185 Share Michael Klein Staff Writer Michael Klein, editor/producer of Philly.com/food, has written about Philadelphia’s restaurant scene since 1993 in his Inquirer column, “Table Talk,” and on his Philly.com blog, “The Insider.” More by Michael Klein Marigold Kitchen's Kochan opening restaurant in Rittenhouse 
Philadelphia's notable finalist is Zahav, the modern Israeli restaurant in Society Hill Towers, which made the lists for chef (Michael Solomonov) and service. Solomonov was a finalist last year and is the last Philadelphian to win the Mid-Atlantic chef category (in 2011). His cookbook Zahav was the Beard's cookbook of the year in 2016. 
Zahav sous chef Camille Cogswell (right) also was nominated for rising star chef of the year. 
For best chef in the Mid-Atlantic region, Rich Landau of Vedge/V Street/Wiz Kid and Greg Vernick of Vernick Food & Drink are finalists for the second consecutive year. 
Stephen Starr of Starr Restaurants is a nominee again for restaurateur. His New York restaurant Le Coucou is a nominee for best new restaurant. 
Sam Calagione, of Dogfish Head Craft Brewery, was nominated again for wine, spirits, or beer professional.
